Should the Flyers be pursuing the Minnesota defenseman?
 It appears that Dougie Hamilton, the headliner of the 2021 free-agent market, is not the Flyers‚Äô top priority.
In the latest edition of 31 Thoughts, Elliotte Friedman reports that the Flyers‚Äô defensive targets seem to be elsewhere. He later expands on this point:
15. Philadelphia‚Äôs got a lot of balls in the air. I figured they‚Äôd be in on Hamilton, but, as mentioned above, he doesn‚Äôt appears to be their top target. I‚Äôm speculating here, but my guesses would include Seth Jones and Matt Dumba (who GM Chuck Fletcher knows very well). It also wouldn‚Äôt be a shocker if they have asked the Coyotes about 2019 first-rounder Victor Soderstrom. The Flyers liked him at that draft, and Arizon‚Ä¶
articles.title: Is Matt Dumba the Flyers‚Äô move?

articles.description:
Photo by Al Bello/Getty Images
    

  
We are no longer feeling the shake.
 A mark of greatness is a memorable gimmick, something that sticks in the minds of fans generations after the story of a team has come to a close. Remarkable periods of success are best enjoyed when there‚Äôs a certain moment, playoff run, or player that remains iconic even as time passes and the luster of a franchise is eroded by mismanagement and failure. These are the gems of the past that we, as Flyers fans, cling to; occurrences that gave us hope, that compel us to root for this infuriating product year in and year out.
Looking at recent examples, Simon Gagn√©‚Äôs Game 6 overtime winner, Claude Giroux‚Äôs overtime goal in the Stanley Cup Final, and Giroux‚Äôs magical shift back in the 2012 series against the Penguins c‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Flyers owe their fans a better goal song

articles.description:
Photo by Codie McLachlan/Getty Images
    

  
We‚Äôve got a goalie in the mix, folks!
 At long last! We‚Äôre closing out the top-10 and we finally have a goaltender entering the draft board mix. 
Jesper Wallstedt had, in short, a pretty stellar season. At just 18 years old, he made a full time debut with Lule√• of the SHL, and was really well able to hit the ground running. His team finished 5th in the SHL on the season with a loss in the quarterfinals, and Wallstedt was a key piece in that success. It was just about an even split of the workload for the goalies, with Wallstedt playing in 22 of their 52 games, and not looking even a bit out of place in his role. It‚Äôs really hard to overstate how huge that is for a player of his age, and that leaves us with a lot to be excited about with regard‚Ä¶
articles.title: BSH 2021 Community Draft Board, No. 10: Jesper Wallstedt

articles.title: Monday Morning Fly By: Sports were a mistake

articles.description:
Via NHL.com | Via NHL.com
    

  
The Flyers could really use Finnish dudes, even if this one is possibly the Finnish Nolan Patrick. 
 Aatu R√§ty is a prospect that falls at No. 9 here on our big board, which might end up being the top end of where he could fall in the actual draft later this summer. 
R√§ty‚Äôs name has been on the scouting communities mind for a few years now ‚Äî and at one point even looked like sure-fire top-five pick just a few seasons ago, with mentions along the likes of his Finnish countrymen Mikko Rantanen and Aleksander Barkov depending on who you talked to. 
But that stand-out 2018-19 season (.75 points per game) is firmly in the rearview mirror as R√§ty has seen his production decrease in each of the past few seasons ‚Äî albeit coinciding with a rise in competition up f‚Ä¶
articles.title: BSH 2021 Community Draft Board, No. 9: Aatu R√§ty

articles.description:
Photo by Len Redkoles/NHLI via Getty Images
    

  
Trade for Eichel! Do it! 
 The Flyers have similar needs to last year this offseason. In fact, they have the same needs this offseason as the last.
Despite the similarities, the main difference as the Flyers approach free agency this season is the shift in attitude. After the Flyers‚Äô success during the end of the 2019-20 season in the Toronto bubble (for lack of a better term, we can consider winning a playoff series a success), the team and front office staff had every right to feel confident with the group at hand, and thus, major moves were not a focus that offseason. However, a disappointing 2020-21 campaign exposed the flaws in the Flyers‚Äô handling of their key weaknesses, and the optimism present a year ago no longer exists as bois‚Ä¶
articles.title: What is the Flyers‚Äô greatest positional need in free agency/the offseason?

articles.description:
Photo by Bill Wippert/NHLI via Getty Images
    

  
In which the gang shifts the trade conversation.¬†
 The Stanley Cup Final draws ever closer and the gang has a few thoughts about the two not-conference-final series currently being played. Then it is on to the Flyers and the latest rumors about the acquisition of a defenseman this offseason as well as a conversation about a new, spicier rumor about who the Flyers might be interested in this summer.
articles.title: BSH Radio #310: Bring forth the Jack Attack

articles.description:
Photo by Tim Nwachukwu/Getty Images
    

  
Today‚Äôs open discussion thread, complete with your daily dose of Flyers news and notes‚Ä¶  
 *The talk of the Flyers being out on Dougie Hamilton persists. Rumors, rumors everywhere. [The Hockey News]
*But a new rumor seems to be picking up steam. A Buffalo-based rumor. [Philly Hockey Now]
*We started our own rumor too. Well, we proposed an idea. One that involves maximum chaos. [BSH]
*In the latest of the Seattle Kraken mock drafts, the panel of experts agree that Ron Francis will simultaneously be taking a good player from the Flyers and doing the Flyers a big favor. [The Athletic]
*Next up in our Community Draft is a kid whose name makes him sound like a 43 year old man. [BSH]
*Our pals over at the Pens blog did us the favor of rounding up all of the various rumors and happenings in the Metro Division. [Pensburgh]
*Rod Brind‚ÄôAmour is this year‚Äôs Jack Adams winner, and rightfully so. [Canes Country]
*A common theme these playoffs has been offense coming from the defense. Goals, they‚Äôre good. [ProHockeyTalk]
*The annual NHLPA player poll was released yesterday. Always interesting to see what these guys think of each other. [NHLPA]
*And finally, there‚Äôs a new episode of BSH Radio for you to consume, if you‚Äôd like:
articles.title: Friday Morning Fly By: So many rumors

articles.description:
Photo by Dave Reginek/Getty Images
    

  
A little more Wolverines love. 
 We‚Äôre taking a break from talking about defensemen to talk about... well would you look at that, it‚Äôs another Michigan Wolverine. In these draft talks, Owen Power and Matty Beniers have been getting a lot of love, deservedly, but they have another teammate who‚Äôs eligible for this draft and probably deserves to have a bit more hype himself. 
Kent Johnson had, in short, a really stellar freshman season with Michigan. He finished the season 12th in scoring in the conference, and second among freshman, behind teammate Thomas Bordeleau. It took a bit of time to adjust, but he was a real impact player for the Wolverines this season, and pretty quickly asserted himself as one of the most dynamic playmakers on an already ‚Ä¶
articles.title: BSH 2021 Community Draft Board, No. 8: Kent Johnson

articles.description:
Photo by Len Redkoles/NHLI via Getty Images
    

  
In which Eamon does his best Paul Holmgren impression.
 The Flyers are on the hunt for an impactful star player, one who can become the centerpiece of this upcoming generation after the former crown jewels (Nolan Patrick, Ivan Provorov, and Carter Hart) all regressed this past year. In particular, the team has reason for concern at forward. Outside of single season performances from Travis Konecny, Oskar Lindblom, and Joel Farabee, the Orange & Black are devoid of young talent up front that looks remotely capable of supplanting the aging star trio of Giroux, Voracek, and Couturier. Recent reports have put the Flyers in play for Jack Eichel, but his enormous contract and coveted status across the league will likely impose a heavy toll on ‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Flyers should take a crack at offer sheeting Elias Pettersson.

articles.description: Unrested is a new grind band from Spain. But this not a usual newcomers, this squad consists of musicians from Convulsions, Denak, and Tu Carne. So as you can see these guys know how to make us happy, ha! The cover art of this LP is based on an old movie ‚ÄúClockwork Orange‚Äù (at least the main character), the image looks unprofessional, and I find this moment very cool. This band has a very strong DIY spirit in design and music, which I really like. Like the other grindcore bands from Spain Unrested is very emotional. But also guys blast ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Unrested ‚Äì Dosis De Realidad

articles.description: LCKR is very proud to present you a new, promising german underground band in ANTRO. The band members are not unknown and have been active in POWERAGE, HEXER, ATAXIE and INNENSTADTFRONT among others. ANTRO deliver on their 7-track demo a raw as well as rancid sound, somewhere between disgusting old school grindcore √° la Repulsion, wild 80‚Äôs HC punk and a pinch of early extreme metal. In short, this fresh project delivers 7 grindy metalpunk anthems with filthy riffing, groovy to blasting drums and inimitably nasty vocals, perfect for pissing on the graveyard or vomiting on churches. You can pre-order ‚Ä¶

articles.author: goodguysgogrind
articles.description: Human Obliteration¬†released their debut EP on Buriedinhell Records and played their first show October 22nd, 2010. The lineup of Vince Cassinelli and Marc Dickson released 1 more EP in 2011 before parting ways. Marc formed Plague Widow and Vince joined Psychosomatic as touring guitarist until Jimi Hughes (Nerve Grind, SMD touring drummer) joined in 2013 to record the 3rd EP, Blind Submission. After touring and several other live appearances, Human Obliteration released their first full-length, Definition of Insanity, on Give Praise Records/Legion Productions/To Live a Lie Records/Wise Grinds Records in 2020. Two videos were produced for the album for the ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Human Obliteration!

articles.author: goodguysgogrind
articles.description: Schismopathic is a very old Polish grind band, everything starts in 1988(!). The band was gone somewhere at the beginning of the 90th. Now they are back with a brand new album! ‚ÄúThe Human Legacy‚Äù is classical in many meanings, the cover of it has a classical grind theme, some with the lyrics. Nothing outstanding but what do you want from veterans? The re-issue of the old material and this new LP was released by Selfmadegod rec, I think guys will work with this label in the future. So what does this CD have inside? The Human Legacy has 12 ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Schismopathic ‚Äì The Human Legacy
